# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a simple Julia function that accomplishes the task:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String) :: String
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    return col
end
```

This function works by first lowercasing the entire string. Then, it replaces all spaces with underscores. After that, it replaces all hyphens with underscores as well. Finally, it strips leading and trailing whitespaces from the string.
